quotes.quote: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
A man willing to work, and unable to find work, is perhaps the saddest sight that fortune's inequality exhibits under this sun.
The few wonders of the world only exist while there are those with the sight to see them.
The greatest talents often lie buried out of sight.
Sight is something you take for granted until you think you might lose it.
When a man is out of sight, it is not too long before he is out of mind.
To examine oneself makes good use of sight.
Your goal should be out of reach but not out of sight.
Set your sights on a place higher than your eyes can see.
Sight is about what lies right in front of us. Vision is what lies ahead.
You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
The man who views the world at 50 the same he did at 20 has wasted thirty years of his life.
For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.
Those things that nature denied to human sight, she revealed to the eyes of the soul.
As a rule, what is out of sight disturbs men's minds more seriously than what they see.
It is a darned sight easier to find six men who can tell exactly how a thing ought to be did than to find one who will do it.
Eyes of youth have sharp sight, but commonly not so deep as those of elder age.
The sight of a cage is only frightening to the bird that has once been caught.
When a nation goes down, or a society perishes, one condition may always be found; they forgot where they came from. They lost sight of what had brought them along.
There is no better way to thank God for your sight than by giving a helping hand to someone in the dark.
I don't ask for the sights in front of me to change, only the depth of my seeing.
In time of difficulties, we must not lose sight of our achievements.
Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
Failure is where success likes to hide in plain sight.
Never lose sight of the fact that the most important yardstick of your success will be how you treat other people - your family, friends, and coworkers, and even strangers you meet along the way.
We may run, walk, stumble. drive, or fly, but let us never lose sight of the reason for the journey, or miss a chance to see a rainbow on the way.
Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
Anger and jealousy can no more bear to lose sight of their objects than love.
